citations.narrative:
***The guinea pigs have recently been moved into a different enclosure, there is bird excreta and feed waste
accumulation in the enclosure indicating the enclosure was not fully cleaned and sanitized prior to introducing the guinea
pigs. Guinea pigs are highly susceptible to disease hazards and exposing them to such risks may result in illness.
Primary enclosures shall be cleaned and sanitized in the manner provided in paragraph (a)(4) of this section.
Correct by March 19, 2025.

***There are pallets of feed and sweet potatoes stored in the barn. The area where this food is stored is cluttered with
various items such as hoses, buckets, bottles and trash. This clutter increases the risks of food contamination and
harboring rodents.
Supplies of food and bedding shall be stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration,
molding, or contamination by vermin. Refrigeration shall be provided for supplies of perishable food.
Correct by March 20, 2025.

***The ground under the shed roof provided for the zebra is very muddy. The drainage in this area is insufficient to
prevent the accumulation of water which has resulted in the entire surface accumulating mud resulting in no dry area
beneath the shed roof for the zebra to access. Extended exposure to wet and muddy ground may lead to hoof issues and
lameness.
Effective drainage or adequate surfacing shall be provided to prevent accumulation of mud and protect the animals from
hoof problems.
Correct by March 25, 2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
***The nest boxes in the pigeon coup have not been cleaned in a while and there is excessive accumulation of excreta
built up in and on the boxes. Excessive accumulations increases the risk of disease hazards and contamination that may
cause illness.
Excreta shall be removed as often as necessary to prevent such accumulations to reduce disease hazard.
Correct by March 19, 2025.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 16, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Your current license expires March 18, 2025. No Regulated activity may be conducted until the re-licensing process has
been completed and passed.
n

narrative:
3.31(a)(3) 
   
Sanitation. 
***The guinea pigs have recently been moved into a different enclosure, there is bird excreta and feed waste 
accumulation in the enclosure indicating the enclosure was not fully cleaned and sanitized prior to introducing the guinea 
pigs. Guinea pigs are highly susceptible to disease hazards and exposing them to such risks may result in illness.  
 
Primary enclosures shall be cleaned and sanitized in the manner provided in paragraph (a)(4) of this section.  
 
Correct by March 19, 2025. 
3.125(c) 
   
Facilities, general. 
***There are pallets of feed and sweet potatoes stored in the barn. The area where this food is stored is cluttered with 
various items such as hoses, buckets, bottles and trash. This clutter increases the risks of food contamination and 
harboring rodents. 
 
Supplies of food and bedding shall be stored in facilities which adequately protect such supplies against deterioration, 
molding, or contamination by vermin. Refrigeration shall be provided for supplies of perishable food. 
 
Correct by March 20, 2025. 
3.126(d) 
   
Facilities, indoor. 
***The ground under the shed roof provided for the zebra is very muddy. The drainage in this area is insufficient to 
prevent the accumulation of water which has resulted in the entire surface accumulating mud resulting in no dry area 
beneath the shed roof for the zebra to access. Extended exposure to wet and muddy ground may lead to hoof issues and 
lameness.  
 
Effective drainage or adequate surfacing shall be provided to prevent accumulation of mud and protect the animals from

hoof problems. 
 
Correct by March 25, 2025. 
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
***The nest boxes in the pigeon coup have not been cleaned in a while and there is excessive accumulation of excreta 
built up in and on the boxes. Excessive accumulations increases the risk of disease hazards and contamination that may 
cause illness.  
 
Excreta shall be removed as often as necessary to prevent such accumulations to reduce disease hazard. 
 
Correct by March 19, 2025. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 16, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. 
 
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Your current license expires March 18, 2025. No Regulated activity may be conducted until the re-licensing process has 
been completed and passed. 
 
 n
